result.execSummary:
The defendant Bryant B Oglen Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property fr. Person, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence.  Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving one half (1/2) of Initial Confinement.

miscConds.notes: Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge as a condition of probation.  If revoked, to be paid out of up to 25% prison wages.  Any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
Seek and maintain full time employment.

Defendant orderd to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
Mental health assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.

No illegal drugs.  No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community.

Cognitive behavior therapy.
Restitution set at zero.
Alcohol and drug assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Random urine screens.  No positive results.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

timeConds.notes:
The first three (3) months with huber privileges for work, school and treatment.  
The last three (3) months, STAYED to be used by agent for violations.
*5/13/2016  Honorable William S. Pocan.  Order for Commitment signed.  Stay lifted as to 60 days.  Straight time. No good time credit.

records.addlTxt: Letter to defendant regarding sentence credit on condition time.
Letter from defendant requesting sentence credit on condition time.

Order for Commitment for condition time for non-compliance with Probation conditions-domestic violence court, filed and signed by the Court.  The Sheriff of Milwaukee County to take defendant into custody to spend 60 days straight time, with no good time credit, as condition time in the House of Correction for defendant's non-compliance with conditions of probation.
Pursuant to current District Court Rules, this case is assigned and forwarded to Br. 26, Judge Pocan, for review.  jm

Received from the Department of Corrections - Probation, request to:
[    ]   Extend Probation
[    ]   Set Restitution
[    ]   Remove Court Obligations
[ X ]   Review / Modification Request / Recommended
[    ]   Convert Unpaid Obligations to Civil Judgment
Bail Notice/Affidavit mailed to surety on 09/19/14. AR

Defendant Bryant B Oglen in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  Defendant Bryant B Oglen in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.    Statements made by counsel and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of  36 months, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 18 months with credit for 72 days
time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 18 months.

The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 2 years with the following conditions:
*Court ordered condition time of 6 months in the HOC, FIRST 3 MONTHS Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment.  LAST 3 MONTHS IMPOSED BUT STAYED TO BE USED BY AGENT FOR VIOLATIONS.  
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, as a condition of probation.  If revoked, to be paid out of up to 25% prison wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
-  If revoked, Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 1/ of initial confinement.
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

As to the amended charge:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.  Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Court ordered restitution in the amount of $0 (zero).    Case passed for the lunch hour.

Defendant Bryant B Oglen in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  Defendant Bryant B Oglen in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Theft from Person, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943.20(1)(a) and (3)(e), 939.50(3)(g), a Class G felony.    Amended  Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.

Attorney Andrew Joel Golden in court, defendant Bryant B Oglen not in court, in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense request for a court order to the jail for unfairly treating defendant cannot be accommoded by court.   Issue shall be re-addressed after plea hearing; someone from jail staff shall be present.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Andrew Joel Golden in court, defendant Bryant B Oglen not in court, in custody.  Tyrone Martin St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.
State's Motion in Limine received and filed with court.
State's Requested Jury Instructions received and filed with court.

Defendant Bryant B Oglen in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Bryant B Oglen in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Due to breakdown in communication Defendant requesting a new attorney. Court grant request. Court will VACATE Jury Trial set for 09-24-2014. Case adjourned for Status of Counsel in Branch 26. Defendant will not be produced for purposes of the next hearing.  COURT WILL RETAIN FILE.  Status conference scheduled for August 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Bryant B Oglen in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Tyrone St. Junior for James Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Eric Guse-Glendale Police Department Officer.  Upon oral motion by the State, Court amends the criminal complaint to reflect the correction of the city of "Glendale" on in COUNT 1, page 1.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Case is adjourned to Branch 34.  Arraignment scheduled for March 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Bayshore Mall - all stores, grounds, parking lots, residences, offices and adjoining sidewalks or streets.

Defendant Bryant B Oglen in court with attorney Terese M Dick.  Defendant Bryant B Oglen in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Motion to dismiss by defense argued and DENIED by the Court.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.
